content:
As Nezha was about to leave, Macaque appeared out of nowhere, his fur slightly ruffled and his eyes still bright with excitement from the recent battle.

Nezha nodded in greeting. "Macaque, good to see you again."

Macaque bowed his head in respect. "Thank you for your help, Nezha. Without your aid, Wukong might have killed MK."

Nezha smiled. "It was the least I could do. You were instrumental in bringing the diamond snare back to us, and I owe you a debt of gratitude for that."

Macaque chuckled. "It was nothing, really. I'm just glad everything turned out okay in the end."

Nezha nodded. "Yes, it did. And I have to admit, I'm surprised to see you here, Macaque. I thought you would have gone with your monkey brethren when they fled."

Macaque shrugged. "I had to see this through. Wukong was my friend once, but he was also dangerous. I couldn't let him continue to hurt innocent mortals like MK."

Nezha nodded in understanding. "I see. Well, I won't keep you any longer. Take care, Macaque."

Macaque nodded in return. "You too, Nezha."

As Nezha soared away on his chariot, Macaque watched him go before turning and disappearing back into the forest.
